Complaining of a stomach ache

Complaining of a stomach ache

Case Summary

Patient:STACEY MILLER
Disposition:Accident and Emergency as soon as possible
Care Advices: (1) The individual needs to go straight to A+E.
(2) Have someone drive them, they should not drive them self.
(3) Wash hands with soap and water.
(4) To control bleeding, use a clean cloth and apply pressure directly to area for 10 minutes.
Assessment: Does the individual have any of the following symptoms? Gasping for breath at rest, Unable to speak sentences without taking a breath, Continuous wheezing (a tight whistling or musical sound when breathing), Short of breath with minimal activity, Turning blue or pale around lips or nail beds:
No
Does the individual have any of the following symptoms? Cool, or clammy skin (skin feels cold and sweaty), Mottled (patchy discolouration) or excessively pale skin, Fainting or feeling like they are going to pass out:
No
Was the individual injured by being stabbed with an object such as any of the following? Sharp or pointed object such as an ice pick, knife, scissors, or nail gun, Being shot by a bullet or arrow, Being hit by flying debris:
No
Has the skin been cut, torn or scraped?
Yes
Is the wound or cut currently bleeding even after ten minutes of trying to stop the bleeding with direct pressure over the area?
No
You should go straight to Accident and Emergency as soon as possible. Do you wish to search the DoS for providers?
Make alternative arrangements per service model
